marketNews.title: US President Donald Trump orders consideration of retaliatory tariffs
marketNews.content: US President Donald Trump on Thursday (13/2) instructed his cabinet to consider imposing retaliatory tariffs on a number of trading partners. US Trade Secretary Howard Lutnick said all studies related to the retaliatory tariffs will be completed by 1 April 2025, allowing Trump to act immediately thereafter. Bloomberg reported that the retaliatory tariffs will be adjusted for each country to offset tariffs imposed by those partners on US exports. The consideration also covers non‑tariff barriers such as unfair subsidies, regulations, value‑added tax, exchange rates, and lax intellectual‑property protection. Trump also said he would levy higher import duties on automobiles, semiconductors, and pharmaceuticals.

marketNews.title: President Prabowo Subianto announces Danantara investment fund launch
marketNews.content: President Prabowo Subianto on Thursday (13/2) announced that the Danantara Investment Management Agency will be launched on 24 February 2025, with assets under management projected to reach IDR 14.715 trillion. The initial funding is projected at USD 20 billion. Danantara will invest in high‑impact, sustainable projects across sectors such as renewable energy, advanced manufacturing, downstream industry, and food production, aiming to help Indonesia achieve an 8% economic growth target. Danantara will also take over all government ownership in state‑owned enterprises, including Bank Mandiri (BMRI), Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BBRI), and Bank Negara Indonesia (BBNI).

marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia residential property price growth slows to 1.39% YoY in 4Q24
marketNews.content: A residential property price survey by Bank Indonesia showed that price growth slowed to +1.39% year‑over‑year in the fourth quarter of 2024 (3Q24: +1.46% YoY), marking the weakest increase since the fourth quarter of 2021. Meanwhile, residential property sales contracted by -15.09% YoY (3Q24: -7.14% YoY), driven by a decline in small‑type houses (-16.61% YoY vs -10.05% YoY in 3Q24) and medium‑type houses (-23.7% YoY vs -8.8% YoY in 3Q24), while large‑type house sales rose by +20.44% YoY (3Q24: +6.83% YoY).

marketNews.title: Minister Erick Thohir opens option to redesign BUMN Karya merger to a single entity
marketNews.content: State‑Owned Enterprises Minister Erick Thohir on Thursday (13/2) said the government is opening the option to restructure the BUMN Karya merger from seven companies down to a single surviving entity, fewer than the previously planned three entities. He noted that the merger plan could be adjusted further as state spending efficiency improves. Although the consolidation from seven to three entities remains ongoing, the number of surviving entities may be reduced.

marketNews.title: Director General of ESDM announces full implementation of B40 biodiesel program by March 2025
marketNews.content: Director General of the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources, Eniya Listiani Dewi, said the government targets full implementation of the B40 biodiesel program by March 2025, after a transition period caused by delayed technical regulations earlier this year. She noted that biodiesel distribution based on crude palm oil reached about 1.2 million kiloliters on Friday (14/2), equivalent to 7.7% of the 2025 allocation of 15.6 million kiloliters. The 2025 allocation is higher than the 2024 level of 13 million kiloliters, requiring higher subsidies to stimulate production. Previously, the government planned to raise the export levy on crude palm oil from 7.5% to 10% to fund the increased subsidies, but the official decision is still pending.

marketNews.title: Inpex Corp plans final investment decision for Indonesia's Abadi LNG project in 2027
marketNews.content: Japan's largest oil and gas exploration company, Inpex Corp. (TYO: 1605), said on Thursday (13/2) that it will make a final investment decision on the Abadi liquefied natural gas (LNG) project in the Masela Block in 2027. Under its business plan through 2027, Inpex intends to invest 1.8 trillion yen in growth areas, including the Ichthys LNG project in Australia. Inpex holds a 65% stake in the Abadi LNG project and plans to start engineering design in early 2025, with production expected in the early 2030s. The project has faced delays after Shell sold its 35% stake to PT Pertamina and Petronas in 2023.

marketNews.title: Freeport Indonesia to resume copper concentrate exports pending new export permit
marketNews.content: Reuters reported that PT Freeport Indonesia will resume exporting copper concentrate this month if it obtains a new export permit. Sources said Freeport will begin loading cargo destined for China on Friday (14/2), hoping to receive the permit by the end of February 2025. Previously, the Ministry of Trade said it would support Freeport's export of copper concentrate. Neither Freeport nor the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources has commented on the issue.

marketNews.title: eFishery cuts over 1,000 jobs (~90%) amid liquidation speculation
marketNews.content: Bloomberg reported that agritech start‑up eFishery has cut more than 1,000 employees, about 90% of its workforce, as the company, accused of fraud, considers possible liquidation. Bloomberg said the layoffs began recently and further reductions are expected.

tickerNews.title: UNVR FY24: Net Profit -30% YoY, Below Expectations
tickerNews.content: Unilever Indonesia ($UNVR) recorded a net profit of IDR 359 billion in 4Q24 (‑41% YoY, ‑34% QoQ), lower than the net profit in 4Q23 when boycott sentiment peaked. This resulted in a full‑year 2024 net profit of IDR 3.4 trillion (‑30% YoY), below expectations as it met only 90% of the consensus estimate. The ongoing restructuring program remains the main factor pressuring short‑term performance. Sales were hit by a decision to reduce stock at the distributor level, while profitability fell due to transformation costs. Gross margin stayed low at around 45% in the last two quarters (versus the normal 49‑50%) because of lower sales and transformation expenses. In 4Q24, UNVR also recorded one‑off costs related to employee reductions, causing operating salary expenses to surge, with 'Selling & Marketing' up +110% YoY (+67% QoQ) and 'General & Administrative' up +55% YoY (+170% QoQ). Management expects the restructuring program to continue into 1H25, so performance will still be weighed down, though the impact will be less severe than in 4Q24. Positive results from the program are expected to become visible in 2H25. With UNVR share price strengthening by +2.91% on Thursday (13/2) and +3.53% on Friday (14/2), the market responded positively to management's view that the worst performance has passed and future outlook is improving. Progress of the restructuring program should be closely monitored as it will be a key factor in UNVR stock recovery.

tickerNews.title: ISAT denies rumors of acquisition by Solusi Sinergi Digital (WIFI)
tickerNews.content: $ISAT: Indosat, in a clarification to the Indonesia Stock Exchange (BEI), denied rumors that the company will be acquired by Solusi Sinergi Digital ($WIFI). ISAT also stated that, to date, it has not discussed any potential cooperation or acquisition with WIFI.

tickerNews.title: WIFI denies plans to acquire ISAT
tickerNews.content: $WIFI: Solusi Sinergi Digital also denied rumors that it plans to acquire ISAT.

tickerNews.title: BMRI Secretary says Bank Mandiri will continue supporting mineral export financing despite loss of liquidity incentive
tickerNews.content: $BMRI: Bank Mandiri Company Secretary M. Ashidiq Iswara said the bank will continue to support accelerated mineral export financing in Indonesia, even though Bank Indonesia will not extend the liquidity incentive for banks that provide credit for mineral export (hilirisasi) in 2025. He explained that BMRI's export‑financing credit will focus on strategic projects with significant economic impact, requiring borrowers to have sufficient raw material supply and offtaker availability to mitigate risk. Previously, the Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Bahlil Lahadalia, said export‑financing projects would be funded by the Danantara Investment Management Agency through BMRI. In addition, Bank Negara Indonesia ($BBNI) CEO Royke Tumilaar said his bank is ready to provide export‑financing credit if projects are promising, despite the lack of liquidity incentives.

tickerNews.title: DEWA intensifies purchase of new heavy equipment to improve revenue performance
tickerNews.content: $DEWA: Director Darma Henwa Sorimuda Pulungan said the company is intensively buying new heavy equipment to boost revenue performance. The new equipment will allow DEWA to reduce reliance on subcontractors for its mining projects. This decision follows approval of a private placement to convert approximately IDR 1.4 trillion of debt, based on the extraordinary shareholders meeting on Thursday (13/2). Business reported that DEWA currently operates four projects: the Bengalon project owned by PT Kaltim Prima Coal, the Asam Asam project, the Kintap project owned by PT Arutmin Indonesia, and port services at Lubuk Tutung.

tickerNews.title: HEAL major shareholder purchases 1.3 million shares
tickerNews.content: $HEAL: Controlling shareholder and CEO of Medikaloka Hermina, Hasmoro, bought approximately 1.3 million HEAL shares at an average price of IDR 1,304 per share on 11‑12 February 2025. The total transaction value was about IDR 1.7 billion. After the transaction, Hasmoro's ownership in HEAL increased from 4.725% to approximately 4.734%.

tickerNews.title: MIKA controlling shareholder purchases 952,200 shares
tickerNews.content: $MIKA: Controlling shareholder Mitra Keluarga Karyasehat, PT Griyainsani Cakrasadaya, bought 952,200 MIKA shares at an average price of IDR 2,366 per share on 24 January 2025. The total transaction value was about IDR 2.3 billion. After the transaction, PT Griyainsani Cakrasadaya's ownership in MIKA increased from 63.99% to 64%.

tickerNews.title: BRIS obtains OJK license to operate a bullion bank
tickerNews.content: $BRIS: Bank Syariah Indonesia's CEO Hery Gunardi said the bank has obtained an OJK license to operate a bullion bank (gold bank). This makes BRIS the second financial services company to receive a gold‑bank license after Bank Rakyat Indonesia's subsidiary PT Pegadaian. The gold‑bank services include buying, selling, storing, and financing gold. In November 2024, BRIS also partnered with Hartadinata Abadi ($HRTA) to launch the BSI Gold product.

tickerNews.title: BUVA plans rights issue up to 3.6 billion new shares
tickerNews.content: $BUVA: Bukit Uluwatu Villa plans to conduct a rights issue of up to 3.6 billion new shares, resulting in a maximum dilution of 17.48%. The issue price and ratio have not been announced, and the proceeds will be used to finance upcoming projects, inorganic growth, and/or to repay the company's obligations. The plan will be discussed at the extraordinary shareholders meeting on 24 March 2025.

tickerNews.title: MARK director purchases 870,000 shares
tickerNews.content: $MARK: Mark Dynamics Indonesia director Chow Kun Jian bought 870,000 MARK shares at an average price of IDR 950 per share on 14 February 2025. The total transaction value was about IDR 826 million. After the transaction, Chow Kun Jian's ownership in MARK increased from zero to 0.02%.

tickerNews.title: MPMX directors collectively purchase 3.6 million shares
tickerNews.content: $MPMX: Directors of Mitra Pinasthika Mustika each purchased shares of MPMX. Suwito Mawarwati bought 2.2 million shares, Beatrice Kartika bought 1.3 million shares, and Kemal Mawira bought 144,800 shares, all at an average price of IDR 970 per share on 7 February 2025. The total value of the three transactions was about IDR 3.6 billion. After the transactions, Suwito Mawarwati's ownership increased from 0.37% to 0.42%, Beatrice Kartika's from 0.136% to 0.166%, and Kemal Mawira's from 0.005% to 0.008%. The transactions are part of the company's long‑term incentive program.

tickerNews.title: SQMI major shareholder sells 750 million shares
tickerNews.content: $SQMI: Wilton Resources Holding Pte. Ltd., the controlling shareholder of Wilton Makmur Indonesia, sold 750 million SQMI shares at an average price of IDR 20 per share on 6 February 2025. The total transaction value was IDR 15 billion and was intended as collateral. After the transaction, Wilton Resources' ownership in SQMI decreased from 62.87% to 58.04%.
